m_szDocTitle: Public transport gets stuck in middle lane | The Times
m_szDocSumamry: Public transport gets stuck in middle lane  Seán McCárthaigh  Last updated at 12:01AM, November 21 2015  Poor rail facilities and the low number of electric cars has prompted the European Commission to rate Ireland’s transport sector as “average”.  A new “transport scorecard” published yesterday rated the country in 13th place out of the 28 EU members – down from 11th position in a similar study in 2014.  Although the quality of Ireland’s transport infrastructure was “quite positive” for all modes except rail, EU officials pointed out that the country has the lowest share of electrified railwa
